title: Introduction to Communication Skills
headline: Learn techniques for improving your conversational skills and how to use proper body language with this course.
description: This free online introductory Communication Skills course will guide you through the basic rules which govern communication in your everyday life. You will study the basics of communication as well as concepts such as communication channels, interpretation, and barriers. You will learn how to interact with those around you and be a more effective communicator. You will also learn the importance of culture, context, body language, and more!

courseDescription:
This course begins by discussing the difference between soft skills and hard skills. It will teach you the difference between covert and overt communication as well as verbal and nonverbal communication. You will study the different communication channels, filters and barriers, the effect which new technologies have had upon communication, and the importance of culture and context to communication. You will also learn why new technologies have made music and visuals more important.

You will then study the importance of listening in relation to intrapersonal communication, emotion, and support. You will learn the concept of foregrounding, the barriers to effective listening, and how gender can affect the way we speak. With this course, you will also learn the difference between symmetric and asymmetric communication. It will teach you the importance of voice, body language, and silence. Listening and speaking techniques will also be covered.

Improve your communication skills with this free online course from Alison. Listening is an important skill. Speaking is also a vital part of a conversation. This course will help you gain a better understanding of the basics of communication and body language. Upon the completion of this course, you will be able to express yourself effectively and most importantly, learn how to speak considerately and politely. Check out this course today to improve your communication today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module introduces you to communication in the context of soft skills. It draws on the main models of communication to identify the various components of the communication process and to understand potential barriers to achieving effective communication.
topics: Understanding the Communicative Environment  - Learning Outcomes
Understanding the Communicative Environment - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explains the various components involved in the listening and speaking processes. It identifies barriers to effective listening and speaking based on culture, context and personal or environmental factors, and explains strategies for achieving effective inter-personal communication in socio-cultural environments.
topics: What to Listen For and Why

slides:
• Upon successful completion of this module students will be able to:
    • Discuss the difference between soft skills and hard skills.
    • Differentiate between covert and overt communication.
    • Identify different communication channels. 
    • Discuss filters and barriers.
    • Explain the effect which new technologies have had upon communication.
    • Differentiate between verbal and nonverbal communication.
    • Explain what is meant by a leakage in communication.
    • Explain why new technologies have made music and visuals more important. 
    • Discuss the importance of culture and context to communication.
  • Please note: this course consists of videos only.

    Any references to external resources, such as discussion boards and surveys, by the presenter are not a part of this free online course.

• The key points from this module are:
  • Skills
    Hard skills are easily quantifiable and measurable. 
    Soft skills are not easy to pin point and measure.
    Communication is considered a soft skill. 
    Overt communication is explicit.
    Covert communication is unintentional communication, such as someone who is angry trying not to show it and failing.

    Types of Communication
    Covert communication can also mean secret communication. 
    Communication is not simple; it is very complex. 
    There are many different channels of communication, such as voice, speech, text and body language. 
    Channels of communication can either be compatible or contradictory. 
    An example of compatible channels would be smiling when you are happy.
    An example of contradictory channels would be saying something polite while looking angry. 
    Ambiguity is when communication is not very clear.
    Interpretation is making sense of something which is communicated.
    Unless something is very definite there can be very different interpretations.

• The key points from this module are:
  • The importance of listening
    Children need to listen to the language of the adults around them in order to communicate their needs and wants successfully.
    Listening is vital to intrapersonal communication, emotion, and support.
    According to worth the average person spends 45% of their communication time listening. 

    The difference between hearing and listening
    Research indicates that most people believe they are good listeners, however findings suggest that people use only about 25% of their listening capacity. 
    Hearing and listening is not the same thing, for example we hear but don’t listen of a lot of the background noise around us. 
    Every time you listen to something you are foregrounding that sound, you are actively concentrating on listening to that sound.  
    When you are listening, you can hear clichés, facts, thoughts, beliefs, feelings, and emotions.
    Repetitive or well know phrases are clichés.

    Barriers to effective listening
    Facts are the information that we are receiving from the other person.
    You are getting information on the other person’s attitudes and beliefs around specific issues. 
    The other person’s feelings and emotions are also transferred during communication. 
    We convert everything we hear into information and emotions. 
    Barriers to listening can be Linguistic, physical, or psychological. 
    A linguistic barrier is not understanding the language that is being spoken, or the way that the person is speaking the language.
    A physical barrier is being unable to listen due to an issue with your body such as being deaf, or having poor hearing.
